intro: Warionia, commonly known as the African violet, is a genus of flowering plants native to Africa. These plants are characterized by their attractive, velvety leaves and showy, tubular flowers that come in a variety of colors. They are typically grown as houseplants due to their preference for warm, humid environments. Warionia species are part of the Gesneriaceae family and are known for their ability to thrive in indirect light.
